chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
forall x y z : R, x = z -> x > y -> z > y

Premises:
*** [ R : Set ]
Record Metric_Space : Type := Build_Metric_Space { Base : Type; dist : Base -> Base -> R; dist_pos : forall x y : Base, dist x y >= 0; dist_sym : forall x y : Base, dist x y = dist y x; dist_refl : forall x y : Base, dist x y = 0 < -> x = y; dist_tri : forall x y z : Base, dist x y <= dist x z + dist z y } Arguments Build_Metric_Space _%type_scope (_ _ _ _ _)%function_scope
Rgt_sign_neg_pos_rev : forall x y : R, 0 > x -> 0 > x * y -> y > 0
Rgt_sign_pos_neg_rev : forall x y : R, x > 0 -> 0 > x * y -> 0 > y
Rgt_sign_pos_pos : forall x y : R, x > 0 -> y > 0 -> x * y > 0
Rgt_sign_neg_pos : forall x y : R, 0 > x -> y > 0 -> 0 > x * y

Rgt_sign_neg_neg_rev : forall x y : R, 0 > x -> x * y > 0 -> 0 > y

Rgt_sign_pos_pos_rev : forall x y : R, x > 0 -> x * y > 0 -> y > 0

Rmin = fun x y : R => if Rle_dec x y then x else y : R -> R -> R Arguments Rmin (_ _)%R_scope
IZR = fun z : Z => match z with | 0%Z => R0 | Z.pos n => IPR n | Z.neg n => - IPR n end : Z -> R Arguments IZR _%Z_scope : simpl never
Rabs_mult : forall x y : R, Rabs (x * y) = Rabs x * Rabs y
Rgt_neg_pos : forall x : R, 0 > - x -> x > 0
D_x = fun (D : R -> Prop) (y x : R) => D x /\ y <> x : (R -> Prop) -> R -> R -> Prop Arguments D_x _%function_scope (_ _)%R_scope
R_dist = fun x y : R => Rabs (x - y) : R -> R -> R Arguments R_dist (_ _)%R_scope
BinIntDef.Z.add = fun x y : Z => match x with | 0%Z => y | Z.pos x' => match y with | 0%Z => x | Z.pos y' => Z.pos (x' + y') | Z.neg y' => BinIntDef.Z.pos_sub x' y' end | Z.neg x' => match y with | 0%Z => x | Z.pos y' => BinIntDef.Z.pos_sub y' x' | Z.neg y' => Z.neg (x' + y') end end : Z -> Z -> Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.add (_ _)%Z_scope
Z.ge = fun x y : Z => (x ?= y)%Z <> Lt : Z -> Z -> Prop Arguments Z.ge (_ _)%Z_scope
Z.le = fun x y : Z => (x ?= y)%Z <> Gt : Z -> Z -> Prop Arguments Z.le (_ _)%Z_scope
ps_atan_continuity_pt_1 : forall eps : R, eps > 0 -> exists alp : R, alp > 0 /\ (forall x : R, x < 1 -> 0 < x -> R_dist x 1 < alp -> dist R_met (ps_atan x) (Alt_PI / 4) < eps)
Ratan_is_ps_atan : forall eps : R, eps > 0 -> exists N : nat, forall n : nat, (n >= N)%nat -> forall x : R, -1 < x -> x < 1 -> Rabs (sum_f_R0 (tg_alt (Ratan_seq x)) n - ps_atan x) < eps
Zeq_bool = fun x y : Z => match (x ?= y)%Z with | Eq => true | _ => false end : Z -> Z -> bool Arguments Zeq_bool (_ _)%Z_scope
BinIntDef.Z.leb = fun x y : Z => match (x ?= y)%Z with | Gt => false | _ => true end : Z -> Z -> bool Arguments BinIntDef.Z.leb (_ _)%Z_scope
Rabs_pos_lt : forall x : R, x <> 0 -> 0 < Rabs x
BinIntDef.Z.mul = fun x y : Z => match x with | 0%Z => 0%Z | Z.pos x' => match y with | 0%Z => 0%Z | Z.pos y' => Z.pos (x' * y') | Z.neg y' => Z.neg (x' * y') end | Z.neg x' => match y with | 0%Z => 0%Z | Z.pos y' => Z.neg (x' * y') | Z.neg y' => Z.pos (x' * y') end end : Z -> Z -> Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.mul (_ _)%Z_scope

RRle_abs : forall x : R, x <= Rabs x
